message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GT, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the problem of finding minimum hidden guard sets in polygons, which is a classic problem in computational geometry. The problem is related to computational geometry (cs.CG) as it involves visibility and guarding in polygons. The use of histograms in the problem suggests that it may also be related to data structures (cs.DS) and discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The problem of finding minimum hidden guard sets is also related to game theory (cs.GT) as it involves strategic placement of guards. Finally, the proposed algorithm may involve computational complexity (cs.CC) as it claims to have a linear time complexity.
